channel.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
channel.description: Title says it all, I'm looking for uncapped bandwidth as we tend to use 200Gb/month. Good internet speed would be nice to as theres me, my sister and my mother that use it. Anyone know any good deals?

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Graham:

I’d stay away from the “popular” and big ISPs like TalkTalk, Virgin, Sky, BT, etc. They tend to use traffic shaping, throttle you if you go over some threshold - even when they claim you have a much higher download limit, and other dodgy things. There is a reason they’re cheap - because you won’t get a very good service.

Exactly what Virgin do. Customer Service is amazing though I have to admit but problems still happen and I really can’t be bothered with it.

The Outsider:

Sadly there is no perfect internet out there. I bet fibre-optic even has its bad days.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:

I’d stay away from the “popular” and big ISPs like TalkTalk, Virgin, Sky, BT, etc. They tend to use traffic shaping, throttle you if you go over some threshold - even when they claim you have a much higher download limit, and other dodgy things. There is a reason they’re cheap - because you won’t get a very good service.

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

ollie123:

TalkTalk are fucking shit. I never ceased to have problems with them. One day the internet was Ok, the next day the internet was down, the next day the speed was shit etc. Stay away from them.

Know of any others then?

Sick of Virgin. internet will be fine one minute then epic lag the next.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Saphire`, post:11, topic:423601”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=526226.msg3836925#msg3836925 date=1322961031]
Thanks for the input btw people.

I’m wanting 200Gb p/m bandwidth allowance as theres 3 users. Myself I like to game, sister likes to download, mother likes to browse and occasionally stream things.
[/quote]
Go for the talktalk package that gives unlimited download then, it’s truly unlimited unlike the other advertised unlimited ones like sky, who give 80GB as their unlimited package.[/quote]
Thank you, you mentioned bad customer service earlier? Whats wrong with there customer service typically?

Read full topic

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

I have 24/7 calls, I went for a boost package that cost me £4.00 extra. The customer service isn’t the best, but my internet speed for my area is pretty good.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Yeah TalkTalk are actually pretty good. Free weekend and evening calls?

Read full topic

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

I recently bought internet for my new home, I’m paying £24.35 a month for 40GB download @ 24Mbps and unlimited land-line calls. I decided too go with talktalk, they seem to have good offers on all the time and the boost packages come very cheap! I’m thinking of upgrading the internet too unlimited download allowance in February, thus making the bill £28.35/month. Pretty cheap if you ask me, that’s including line rental.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I am not sure if you are referring to a phone bandwidth or a regular computer internet bandwidth.

For a phone I would suggest Nextel.
For a computer I would suggest Comcast ( if it’s in the UK)

Read full topic

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Ideally looking for phone + internet together. No tv though as that tends to cost the most.

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

You have to pay more JUST for internet. So the cheaper option is to get a package (internet, phone and T.V.) and you’re looking at about £21 a month from Sky.

Probably £30 for the unlimited upgrade.

Hence why I’m still on dial-up.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:2, topic:423601”]Sky do £10 a month package… but I think there’s a catch where line rental is £11 a month. So £21 a month, and if you want unlimited it’s like an extra £5 or £10.

Virgin and BT are both good. I suppose. What’s the maximum you’re willing to spend?[/quote]
Virgin’s horrible:/. £20 or less for internet, what do you get with the phone?

Read full topic

item.title: Good Internet Provider in Britain?
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
